results.definition: (frequently plural) an expense not budgeted or not specified
examples: he requested reimbursement of $7 for incidental expenses

results.definition: (sometimes followed by `to') minor or casual or subordinate in significance or nature or occurring as a chance concomitant or consequence
examples: the road will bring other incidental advantages
extra duties incidental to the job
labor problems incidental to a rapid expansion
confusion incidental to a quick change

results.definition: not of prime or central importance
examples: nonessential to the integral meanings of poetry"- Pubs.MLA

results.definition: following or accompanying as a consequence
examples: an excessive growth of bureaucracy, with attendant problems
snags incidental to the changeover in management
the period of tension and consequent need for military preparedness
the ensuant response to his appeal
